DrLiuScene1: ^Hello Ms. Nyugen. Newest update on the body!
^From what we could gather in this short time, here is what we figured out about the wound and the murder weapon:
^The reason for Bain's blood loss was a tear on her neck. It was caused by a stab wound to the carotid that opened a rather large hole.
^It was actually left at the crime scene— a luxury metal hairpin owned by the victim herself.
^We are testing fingerprints on it, but I wouldn’t hold out much hope.
^One thing I can say to you is that whoever used it was either very familiar with human anatomy or with the hairpin itself.
^Shameful to say, but this information leans more towards the police detective’s job than your attorney's work, but well, use it however you want. Good luck!
^No, I think this would definitely be useful. Thank you, Dr. Liu!
^Then Dr. Liu turned around and left...
